definition[0]: to remove something from the surface of a liquid, especially floating fat, solids, or oil
example[0]: After simmering the meat, skim the fat from the surface.
definition[1]: to read something quickly to find the main facts or ideas in it
example[2]: Just skim through the second section to save time.
definition[2]: to move along quickly over a surface, never touching it or not touching it often
example[4]: The ball skimmed across the grass and stopped against the wall.
definition[3]: to secretly record the details of someone’s credit card  electronically in order            to use them illegally
definition[4]: to take money illegally, for example by not saying that you have made profits so that you do not have to pay tax
example[5]: He was accused of skimming profits from junk bond trading.
example[6]: Corrupt profiteers have skimmed off much of the nation’s vast mineral wealth over the past decades.
